newsitem.title: USA: Capstar Broadcasting to buy three radio stations.
newsitem.headline: Capstar Broadcasting to buy three radio stations.

text.p: Capstar Broadcasting Partners, a radio investment group, said Thursday it agreed to acquire three radio stations in Birmingham, Ala., for about $31 million.

Austin, Texas-based Capstar, which was formed last year by the private investment firm of Hicks, Muse, Tate & Furst Inc. of Dallas, is acquiring the station from the privately held Ameron Broadcasting Inc.
The transaction brings to 172 the number of stations Capstar has acquired or announced plans to acquire since the company's formation in May 1996.

The Birmingham stations Capstar has agreed to acquire are WERC-AM, WMJJ-FM, and WOWC-FM. When the deal is completed, Ameron Chief Executive Bill Thomas will be joining Capstar's management team, the company said.
Hicks, Muse, Tate & Furst has about $19 billion in capital.
